body:
### Describe the bug

We are trying to upgrade from cython 0.29 to 3.0.2 and are seeing an internal compiler crash:
```
> cython --cplus -3 test.pyx

Error compiling Cython file:
------------------------------------------------------------
...
    cppclass Derived(Base):
        @staticmethod
        bint foo()

def test():
    Derived.foo()
           ^
------------------------------------------------------------

test.pyx:11:11: Compiler crash in AnalyseExpressionsTransform

ModuleNode.body = StatListNode(test.pyx:1:0)
StatListNode.stats[1] = DefNode(test.pyx:10:0,
    is_cyfunction = True,
    modifiers = [...]/0,
    name = 'test',
    np_args_idx = [...]/0,
    outer_attrs = [...]/2,
    py_wrapper_required = True,
    reqd_kw_flags_cname = '0',
    used = True)
File 'Nodes.py', line 397, in analyse_expressions: StatListNode(test.pyx:11:15)
File 'Nodes.py', line 5994, in analyse_expressions: ExprStatNode(test.pyx:11:15)
File 'ExprNodes.py', line 636, in analyse_expressions: SimpleCallNode(test.pyx:11:15,
    analysed = True,
    use_managed_ref = True)
File 'ExprNodes.py', line 6066, in analyse_types: SimpleCallNode(test.pyx:11:15,
    analysed = True,
    use_managed_ref = True)
File 'ExprNodes.py', line 7360, in analyse_types: AttributeNode(test.pyx:11:11,
    attribute = 'foo',
    initialized_check = True,
    is_attribute = 1,
    is_called = 1,
    needs_none_check = True,
    result_is_used = True,
    use_managed_ref = True)
File 'ExprNodes.py', line 7407, in analyse_as_type_attribute: AttributeNode(test.pyx:11:11,
    attribute = 'foo',
    initialized_check = True,
    is_attribute = 1,
    is_called = 1,
    needs_none_check = True,
    result_is_used = True,
    use_managed_ref = True)
File 'ExprNodes.py', line 7408, in <listcomp>: AttributeNode(test.pyx:11:11,
    attribute = 'foo',
    initialized_check = True,
    is_attribute = 1,
    is_called = 1,
    needs_none_check = True,
    result_is_used = True,
    use_managed_ref = True)
File 'ExprNodes.py', line 7440, in _create_unbound_cmethod_entry: AttributeNode(test.pyx:11:11,
    attribute = 'foo',
    initialized_check = True,
    is_attribute = 1,
    is_called = 1,
    needs_none_check = True,
    result_is_used = True,
    use_managed_ref = True)

Compiler crash traceback from this point on:
  File "d:\temp\cython-test\cython3\Lib\site-packages\Cython\Compiler\ExprNodes.py", line 7440, in _create_unbound_cmethod_entry
    cname = "%s->%s" % (type.vtabptr_cname, entry.cname)
                        ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
AttributeError: 'CppClassType' object has no attribute 'vtabptr_cname'
```

### Code to reproduce the behaviour:

```cython
cdef extern from "foo.h" nogil:
    cppclass Base:
        @staticmethod
        bint foo()

    cppclass Derived(Base):
        @staticmethod
        bint foo()

def test():
    Derived.foo()
```


### Expected behaviour

Code compiles successfully and ends up calling `Derived::foo()`.

### OS

Windows

### Python version

3.11.2

### Cython version

3.0.2

### Additional context

Regression from 0.29.

comment_data.body:
Note: #2167 is a similar error message, but seems to be a different bug.
This crash is in `_create_unbound_cmethod_entry`; 2167 was `analyse_as_type_attribute`.
This bug involves inheritance, 2167 had optional parameters.
This crash is a regression from 0.29, 2167 was already present in 0.29.

title: [BUG] AttributeError: 'CppClassType' object has no attribute 'vtabptr_cname' in _create_unbound_cmethod_entry
